gnojek

Kanye West and Jesse Jackson and a host of others have said that the federal response to Katrina was slow because the people in need were black.
 
 That's the most idiotic thing I've ever heard (next to 'let's not rebuild').
 
 White people are suffering too.
 
 The reason the response was slow was multifold:
 
 1< Diverted resources
 2< Inadequate preparedness
 3< Too many levels of beauracracy
 4< Lawyers have to ask other lawyers if it's legal for one or another agency to send help where there are other agencies present
 
 I'm sure there are many other reasons, but race is just simply not one of them.
 
 BUT, at the risk of sounding racist myself, if Jesse Jackson and Kanye West want to play race cards, then I have some questions for them.
 
 What color are the people who are roaming the streets in armed gangs looting and raping?
 What color are the people starting fires?
 What color are the people shooting at rescuers?
 
 I PROMISE YOU THEY ARE NOT WHITE.
 
 These thugs most likely came from housing projects like Desire and Iberville, where white people just do not go or they will be lucky to only be mugged.
 
 Now, does pointing these FACTS out make me racist?
 Hell no, it's just a response to certian people's foolishness.

West also said America is set up "to help the poor, the black people, the less well-off as slow as possible."

 That's called generalizing.
 
 
"National Guard is the worst people in the world. They treated us like animals," said survivor Brenda Collins on Saturday when interviewed at Houston's Astrodome.
 
 If victims like her were white, "they'd be in apartments," she said.
 
 When asked why, she said: "Because of the colour of their skin ... that's just the way it is."

 What apartments?
 
 My aunt and uncle (white) finally made it to the astrodome after relying on private citizens since the government played absolutely no part in their rescue, and were denied entry. They had to sleep outside while some other people they met kept watch. So much for fancy apartments for whitey. They finally had to wait for my father to drive to Houston to come pick them up. Now they will live with them for a while.
 
 
Gail Reaben, a white volunteer helping the evacuees, echoed that view: "If New Orleans was 99 per cent white instead of 99 per cent black, I think on that second day Tuesday, George Bush would have had all kinds of help going in there to get those people out."
